001/**
002 * This class is part of the RPandaScape application. 
003 * RPandaScape is a very simple, text based adventure game.
004 * 
005 * This class holds information about a command that was issued by the user.
006 * A command currently consists of three strings: a command word, a second
007 * word and a third one (for example, if the command was "take apple 3", then the 3 strings
008 * obviously are "take", "map" and 3).
009 * 
010 * The way this is used is: Commands are already checked for being valid
011 * command words. If the user entered an invalid command (a word that is not
012 * known) then the command word is null.
013 *
014 * If the command had only one word, then the second and third word are null.
015 * 
016 * @author Elie DUBOUX 
017 * @version 2021.10.27 + 2021.12.12
018 */
019public class Command
020{
021    /**
022     * The Command word.
023     */
024    private String aCommandWord;
025    /**
026     * The second word.
027     */
028    private String aSecondWord;
029    /**
030     * The third word.
031     */
032    private String aThirdWord;
033    
034    /**
035     * Create a command object. First, second and third word must be supplied, 
036     * they can be null.
037     * @param pCommandWord The first word of the command. Null if the command
038     *                  was not recognised.
039     * @param pSecondWord The second word of the command.
040     * @param pThirdWord The third word in a command.
041     */
042    public Command(final String pCommandWord, final String pSecondWord, final String pThirdWord)
043    {
044        this.aCommandWord   = pCommandWord;
045        this.aSecondWord    = pSecondWord;
046        this.aThirdWord     = pThirdWord;
047    }//Command()
048    
049    /**
050     * Return the command word (the first word) of this command. If the
051     * command was not understood, the result is null.
052     * @return The command word.
053     */
054    public String getCommandWord()
055    {
056        return this.aCommandWord;
057    }//getCommandWord()
058    
059    /**
060     * Return the second word of this command. If the command was not
061     * understood, the result is null.
062     * @return The second word.
063     */
064    public String getSecondWord()
065    {
066        return this.aSecondWord;
067    }//getSecondWord()
068    
069    /**
070     * Return the third word of this command. If the command was not
071     * understood, the result is null.
072     * @return The third word.
073     */
074    public String getThirdWord()
075    {
076        return this.aThirdWord;
077    }//getThirdWord()
078    
079    /**
080     * Check if the command has a second word.
081     * @return True if the command has a second word,
082     * false if it does not.
083     */
084    public boolean hasSecondWord()
085    {
086        return this.aSecondWord != null;
087    }//hasSecondWord()
088    
089    /**
090     * Check if the command has a third word.
091     * @return True if the command has a third word,
092     * false if it does not.
093     */
094    public boolean hasThirdWord()
095    {
096        return this.aThirdWord != null;
097    }//hasThirdWord()
098    
099    /**
100     * Get and transform the third word if it is a number.
101     * @return The third word if it is a number, 1 if not.
102     */
103    public int getThirdWordNumber()
104    {
105        if (!this.hasThirdWord())
106            return 1;
107        
108        int d = 1;
109        try 
110        {
111            d = Integer.parseInt(this.aThirdWord);
112        }
113        catch (NumberFormatException e) 
114        {
115            d = 1;
116        }
117        finally
118        {
119            return d;
120        }
121    }//isThirdWord()
122    
123    /**
124     * Check if the command exist in CommandWords
125     * @return True if the commandWord doesn't exist,
126     * false if it is.
127     */
128    public boolean isUnknown()
129    {
130        return this.aCommandWord == null;
131    }//isUnknown()
132} // Command
